list-item.p: The first SARS case was reported around the world on January 2, 2003; a hospital in Heyuan city of Guangdong province hospitalized two patients’ with severe pulmonary infection of unknown cause, which was the first traceable report of “SARS” around the global.
On February 28, 2003, SARS was first diagnosed by the WHO expert Carlor Urbani in Hanoi of Vietnam, who also named this new unexplained disease “ Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome” (SARS).
